name: metaldehyde production | metaldehyde | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6109/documentation

This dataset represents the production of metaldehyde  (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation.  Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of precursor (acetaldehyde) at the factory gate.

This activity ends with  metaldehyde at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Metaldehyde is a pesticide produced by polymerization of acetaldehyde in aqueous ethanol in the presence of HBr and alkaline-earth metal bromides:;4 C2H4O → C8H16O4

exchanges.description:
Metaldehyde is a white or colourless crystalline solid with a mild characteristic odor and a powdery appearance. It is the cyclic tetramer of acetaldehyd. It is moderately soluble in water, fairly soluble in toluene, and readily soluble in methanol It may be formulated with or without calcium arsenate and is also available in a mixed formulation with thiram. It is flammable and burns with a nonsmoking flame. It is dangerous when exposed to heat or flame and can react with oxidizing materials. Thermal decomposition of metaldehyde may release toxic oxides of carbon. Mixtures of metaldehyde dust and air may explode. It is compatible with other substances that are in neutral media. Metaldehyde is noncorrosive.
The molluscicidal activity of metaldehyde has been exploited in South Africa since 1934 and was discovered independently in France in 1936. Ingestion of metaldehyde causes irreversible permeability of the gut walls of gastropods and leads to their death. However, under favorable weather conditions (low temperature, high relative humidity), gastropods often survive the paralysis produced on contact with the compound and the increased slime production caused by irritation. Metaldehyde is also effective in the vapor phase and kills gastropod eggs. Different species are affected to differing degrees.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

flow.name: metaldehyde
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

exchanges.description:
Estimation, based on a production capacity of 50,000 t per year and a plant life time of 50 years, therefore an amount of 4X10-10 units per kg of produced chemical  is aded to the unit process of the respective chemical. The amount is accounted for each production step. This might be an overestimation in some multistep syntheses.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming that the remaining amount of unreacted input materials leave the production process with the wastewater, wich is further treated in an internal wastewater plant.
Estimation, based on the assumption that 0.2% of volatile input materials is emitted to air occurring from the purge vent, the destillation vent and fugitive emission sources.

flow.name: Acetaldehyde
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that includes 50% natural gas.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.

Further references:

Kim S., Overcash M.: Energy in chemical manufacturing processes: gate-to-gate information for life cycle assessment. In: Journal of Chemical Technology & Biotechnology vol. 78,  no. 9: 995-1005(11). 2003

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=UCTE
Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of electricity of 0,333 kW for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 38% electricity.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.

Further references:

Kim S., Overcash M.: Energy in chemical manufacturing processes: gate-to-gate information for life cycle assessment. In: Journal of Chemical Technology & Biotechnology vol. 78,  no. 9: 995-1005(11). 2003

exchanges.description:
Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 12% steam from external energy sources.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.

Further references:

Kim S., Overcash M.: Energy in chemical manufacturing processes: gate-to-gate information for life cycle assessment. In: Journal of Chemical Technology & Biotechnology vol. 78,  no. 9: 995-1005(11). 2003

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Estimation, based on the assumption that 0.2% of volatile input materials is emitted to air occurring from the purge vent, the destillation vent and fugitive emission sources. Remaining gases like CH4 or CO are oxidated to CO2. The carbon contained in the removed carbon compounds from wastewater treatment was accounted as CO2 emissions to air (assuming  a removal efficiency of 90%).
